Speaker: ally
Dialogue: You're the second member of this family I've washed dishes with.

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: He was doing it to impress you. He's never washed a dish in his life.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: That's exactly him. It's like the cigarette is the last Coca Cola in the desert.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: I can't believe he smokes in front of you.

Speaker: caroline
Dialogue: Don't worry, I'm not that impressionable.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: You know when I was younger, we didn't have air conditioning in the house, so during the summer my mom and I would go to museums to cool down... she loved them all but The Met was always her favorite.

Speaker: caroline
Dialogue: Mine too. The Met is one of my favorite places in the world.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: So... I heard you've got an art exhibit coming up.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: Was it that obvious? But only if you're OK with it. I don't want to impose and I'll completely understand if you don't want some random girl there.

Speaker: caroline
Dialogue: You're not random... you're Tyler's girlfriend.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: Let's just skip dinner and I'll tell you how great you look in like eighteen different languages.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: You just want to skip dinner. I got you a tie.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: I was going to make a joke about how I'm not prepared for the commitment of exchanging accessories and how neck wear especially is a slippery slope, but I should probably shut up and say thank you.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: You're learning.  Tyler puts on his tie in the mirror. He scowls.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: Yeah. Every Tuesday with my pop.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: He's allowed to stand me up. But he's not allowed to stand you up. Or my sister.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: This is Alicia Craig. Ally, my father, Charles Roth.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: You're going to be a social worker?

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: Yes. But with an area of focused responsibility. It's easier to find a job that way.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: When I was little I wanted to play first base for the Mets. I don't think it's any harder than that.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: Dad's a Yankee fan. It has something to do with the payroll.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: It has to do with significant ball playing. You were a Yankees fan when you were little. You were Lou Piniella for Halloween.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: Blind familial allegiance. I didn't know what overpriced, overfed, fat bastards they were.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Who's fat? What Yankee is fat? Tell me.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: How long has your dad been a cop?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Would you excuse me please... I'm so sorry.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: It's just a call. He held out 'til dessert.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: She passed away when I was eleven.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: She was murdered. I was there.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: I never told you that part.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: Why are you saying this now?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: I have to go to the office.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: You have somewhere else to be, Dad.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: The exhibit runs til nine. You guys take the car. I'll meet you.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: I don't have to justify anything to you. Take the car. I'll get a cab. I'll meet you.

Speaker: caroline
Dialogue: I'm ready to go home now.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: I have something I've got to do.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: Are you capable of taking care of yourself for an hour? Do you need me here every minute, or what?  He slams out.  Ally looks like she's been slapped.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: You have a daughter who sincerely believes you don't like her.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: If I have any questions about what my daughter may believe, I'll let you know.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: Don't you at least want to know her? She's telling you something, Dad. She's communicating. Why aren't you riveted? Why isn't this the most important thing? At least for one night of your life?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: I've heard this song before, Tyler.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: She knows I will take care of her.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: And that I love her. I love her. Good God, you toss that word around like currency. You have no idea what it means.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: Maybe not. Maybe Caroline doesn't either. Where would she have learned it?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: I have provided her world. And yours.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: That does not mean you're allowed to shatter it whenever there's something better to do.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Who the hell do you think you're talking to? You pedaled down here on your bike for Christ's sake. You have to take care of nothing. You are responsible for no one. You're a kid. You think you're the first one to lose anything? Do you think that there is anything you feel that I haven't already felt?

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: You didn't find him. I found him. And you're so tragically blind, the rest of your children are going to hang themselves on your watch.

Speaker: les
Dialogue: I genuinely have no idea...are you having a seizure?

Speaker: caroline
Dialogue: Gross. Gross. Gross me out the door.

Speaker: aidan
Dialogue: Holy crap. What's with all the smiling?

Speaker: caroline
Dialogue: A child could do Berlin Alexanderplatz, you spaz.

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: I want five minutes with my child before she ceases to be a child and decides I'm ruining her life.

Speaker: aidan
Dialogue: Dinners out, movies. Regular sex. That could be all right. For like, a summer.

Speaker: aidan
Dialogue: And I've had all the races.

Speaker: aidan
Dialogue: I've had all the races. I've been with girls from every...race.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: That is the stupidest thing you've ever said, including that time with the bong in the emergency room.

Speaker: aidan
Dialogue: Please. Like falling off a log. As a matter of fact...

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: A Latin girl actually slept with you? What's her name? She's out of the club.

Speaker: aidan
Dialogue: Monica Ipellie. She works at the Public Library on 96th street.

Speaker: aidan
Dialogue: Inuit. In-u-it, Ally. Try not to show your ignorance.

Speaker: aidan
Dialogue: Fine. Nice girl. While we were doing it, I couldn't get this little, like, song out of my head...

Speaker: aidan
Dialogue: "Inuit, bum buh bum, I'm banging an Inuit, bum buh bum buh bum..."

Speaker: aidan
Dialogue: You wanna go to the library?

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: The minute we get off this train.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: I'll skip this particular bloodbath, thank you.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: bum buh bum bum buh bum buh bum...

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: What are you doing in my house?

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: She's not here now. She's at the library.

Speaker: craig
Dialogue: I didn't think so. I figured you'd probably leave that up to me when you're done with her.

Speaker: craig
Dialogue: That's true, Tyler Roth, son of Charles and Diane. Brother of Caroline and Michael, deceased, suicide by hanging. You're kinda lost, aren't you? Taking a little vacation in coach before finding your way back to first class?

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: I'm the one she came to when you used her face as a punching bag.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: He banged an Inuit! She's really nice. And smart. I don't get it.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: He knows me. Before I met you. He arrested me and Aidan. He gave me that gash over my eye.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: I mouthed off to him. He ... responded. Then Aidan saw you guys together at school.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: Don't do that. What are you doing?

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: Do you realize what you've done?

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: Did you think I would never find out? I mean, think about it. I had to find out eventually. You set it up that way.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: But it doesn't mean anything. I didn't mean to hurt you,

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: No. That's exactly what you meant to do.

Speaker: aidan
Dialogue: You had to tell her eventually...

Speaker: aidan
Dialogue: Glass half full... you just saved yourself an awkward Thanksgiving.

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: I'm sorry, honey. I just... it's nice. Like an end of the summer send off.

Speaker: aidan
Dialogue: Is this the, uh, that is, does, uh, Alicia Craig. Does she live here?

Speaker: craig
Dialogue: You think I don't remember you?

Speaker: aidan
Dialogue: Wait. Shit. This isn't really my thing.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: He'd like to think he is.

Speaker: aidan
Dialogue: I don't know what that means...I've seen him look at one other girl the way he looks at you. She's a lot shorter and shares his DNA.

Speaker: aidan
Dialogue: You don't have to forgive him today... just forgive him.

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: Are you telling me, Ms. Spencer, that you intend to let those girls stay in your school?...Of course they're all sticking to the same story and that story is a load of crap!...

Speaker: les
Dialogue: She's pretty traumatized. I wanted to pull some names together in case we all decide she should talk to someone...

Speaker: les
Dialogue: There's no witnesses and it didn't happen on school property. The school won't do anything. They'll probably get away with it...

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: She's asleep.  He sees Aidan and Ally. Stops short.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: I know you're not here for me but, thank you for being here.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: For what it's worth, I think you're amazing.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: It's not worth much. You made everything between us a lie.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: Okay. Now what? I'm supposed to just forgive you?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: How long do you think she'll sleep?

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: I think she'll be out for a while. Would you like to wait?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Thank you. I can't. I'll call her later.

Speaker: mean girl
Dialogue: Have you done something different with your hair? I love it!

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Destruction of private property and felony trespassing.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: I have unleashed a raging shitstorm of epic proportions on the board of trustees of that pissant school that will not abate until those girls seek enrollment elsewhere. I give them a week.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: I know you think I'm a prick, but I have my uses.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Can you come by the office to talk to the lawyers?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Try not to vandalize any more schools in the meantime.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: Thank you for bailing me out.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: Using the little sister is dirty pool.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: I'll be back in an hour. I have to stop by my dad's office.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: Do you want french toast or pancakes for breakfast?

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: Whichever tastes better a la mode.

Speaker: ally
Dialogue: Say hi to your dad for me.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: If I said I love you... what would you say?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Tyler's coming by the office, but I thought I'd ride to school with Caroline first.

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: Um...OK...sure...yeah...great. She's not ready though, she's going to need at least twenty minutes.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: Are you canceling all together or are you just running late?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Are you already on your way?

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: Take your time. I'll just wait in your office.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: She getting me any? Just kidding.

Speaker: janine
Dialogue: Who do you think scanned all the pictures?

Speaker: janine
Dialogue: It's really been that long? I could've sworn it was...

Speaker: janine
Dialogue: I should be able to remember that. I'm sorry.

Dialogue: Caroline? Hello?  WIDE SHOT of the blackboard. It's unmistakable:  SEPTEMBER 11, 2001
